intro: Tetrapterys maranhamensis, commonly known as the Maranham waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically in Brazil, and is characterized by its palmate leaves with four to five lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing seeds. It is often found in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to the humid tropical climate. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
